channel.title: math.GN updates on arXiv.org
channel.description: math.GN updates on the arXiv.org e-print archive.

item.title: Hyperconvexity in partial metric spaces: challenges and outlooks
item.description: arXiv:2601.02279v2 Announce Type: replace Abstract: In this article, we present several different ways to define hyperconvexity in partial metric spaces. In particular, we show that the analogue of the Aronszajn--Panitchpakdi notion of hyperconvexity fails to exhibit certain key properties present in the classical metric setting.
item.dc:creator: Dariusz Bugajewski, Piotr Kasprzak, Olivier Olela-Otafudu

item.title: Tameness of actions on finite rank median algebras
item.description: arXiv:2601.01681v2 Announce Type: replace-cross Abstract: We prove that for (compact) finite-rank median algebras the geometric rank equals the independence number of all (continuous) median-preserving functions to $[0,1]$. Combined with Rosenthal's dichotomy, this yields a generalized Helly selection principle: for finite-rank median algebras, the space of all median-preserving functions to $[0,1]$ is sequentially compact in the pointwise topology. Generalizing joint results with E. Glasner on dendrons (rank-1), we establish that every continuous action of a topological group $G$ by median automorphisms on a finite-rank compact median algebra is Rosenthal representable, hence dynamically tame. As an application, the Roller-Fioravanti compactification of finite-rank topological median $G$-algebras with compact intervals is often a dynamically tame $G$-system.
item.dc:creator: Michael Megrelishvili
